standard_metadata.standard_description: Know relative sizes of measurement units within one system of units including km, m, cm; kg, g; lb, oz.; l, ml; hr, min, sec. Within a single system of measurement, express measurements in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit. Record measurement equivalents in a two-column table.

question.content: **Which is the closest to the mass of a baby chick?**

hints.content: A small paperclip has a mass of about $1$ gram: [[☃ image 1]]  A wooden baseball bat has a mass of about $1$ kilogram:  [[☃ image 2]]
Is the mass of a baby chick closer to $25$ paperclips (grams) or $25$ baseball bats (kilograms)?
The mass of a baby chick is about $25$ grams.

question.content: **Identify the most reasonable unit to measure the mass of an average adult.**

hints.content: A small paperclip has a mass of about $1$ gram: [[☃ image 1]]  A wooden baseball bat has a mass of about $1$ kilogram:  [[☃ image 2]]
Is it more reasonable to measure how many 'paperclips heavy' a person is or how many 'bats heavy' she is?
Kilograms is the most reasonable unit to measure the mass of an average adult.

Kilograms is the most reasonable unit to measure the mass of a couch.
